QuestD: Players often embark on these in virtual realms, like knights on a mission, seeking to uncover treasures or vanquish foes.
Cheat codeD: A frowned-upon shortcut used by some to gain an unfair advantage, breaking the rules of the game.
NPCD: Silent inhabitants of the game world, following programmed routines, often serving as guides, foes, or merchants.
LagD: The frustrating delay or slow response in online gaming, caused by poor internet connection or overloaded servers.
SpeedrunD: A competitive gaming practice where players aim to complete a game as quickly as possible, often using glitches and precise strategies.
RespawningD: This gaming feature grants a fresh start, ensuring that players return after a virtual setback, ready to resume their quest.
GlitchD: Unintended anomalies in the game code that can lead to unexpected and often amusing consequences for players.
FarmingD: A strategic activity where players repetitively gather in-game resources or experience points to progress in the game.
GrieferD: A player who derives enjoyment from disrupting others' gameplay experience, often through deliberate annoyance or interference.
AFKD: A state in which a player is temporarily absent from their gaming session, leaving their character unattended.
HUDD: The vital on-screen overlay providing key information, seamlessly connecting players to the game's pulse.
NoobD: A term gently bestowed upon newcomers, acknowledging their inexperience in the gaming realm.
SandboxD: A digital playground where creative freedom reigns, allowing players to shape the virtual world according to their whims.
ModdingD: The art of customizing and enhancing games, enabling players to tailor their gaming experience to perfection.
MultiplayerD: The doorway to shared adventures, where players unite online for collaborative and competitive gaming experiences.
StreamerD: An entertainer who broadcasts their virtual adventures live, engaging with a global audience in real-time.
MicrotransactionD: Small, optional in-game purchases offering virtual goods, enhancing the gaming experience for those who choose to indulge.
CosplayD: A hobby where enthusiasts meticulously dress up as their favorite characters from games, movies, or anime.
MOBAD: A genre of fiercely competitive games where teams of players with diverse abilities and skills engage in intense battles, aiming to destroy vital objectives for victory.
MMORPGD: Vast online worlds where players immerse themselves in epic adventures, interacting with a multitude of other participants.
ControllerD: The hand-held device that grants players the power to direct and manipulate the virtual world with precision.
CampaignD: A structured series of challenges, guiding players through a narrative journey within the game.
StealthD: The art of remaining unseen, enabling players to outmaneuver opponents silently and strategically.
SkinsD: Customized appearances for in-game characters or items, enhancing visual aesthetics without affecting gameplay.
ServerD: The digital backbone of online gaming, acting as a central hub for connecting players and hosting game worlds.
CutsceneD: In-game cinematic moments where control temporarily shifts from the player to scripted storytelling.
FPSD: The frequency at which a gaming environment refreshes, dictating the smoothness of visual motion and player experience.
VRD: Technology that transports users into immersive digital realms, blurring the line between reality and simulation.
